page.title: 01SUMMARY OF CORBRIDGE AREA
page.content: Corbridge,with a population of just under 4,000 is situated in the Tynedale Valley in Northumberland.Lying on the banks of the River Tyne it is 17 miles west of Newcastle-upon-Tyne and 3 miles east of Hexham.Nearby lies the hamlet of Sandhoe,Beaufront Castle and the ruins of the Roman fort of Corstopitum from which Corbridge derives its name.The A68,A69 and the Newcastle to Carlisle railway provide major road and rail links.The area is mainly rural,farming being a major occupation.Wooded areas,arable land and sheep grazing land predominate.It is a popular centre for tourists.Corbridge,being primarily residential,provides little industrial or professional employment but is within easy commuting distance of Newcastle and other towns.
